body:
There are compression libraries which use a dictionary, i.e. a common library of pre-calculated data. This dictionary helps to compress data shared by many items only once. To create the dictionary, usually a sample of the items to compress is given to the compression library so that it may derive a useful bad of common data from it.

This would help to compress all items individually while maintaining a compression rate close to a single, "solid" archive.

zstd is an example of such a library, doubtlessly there are many others.
title: How can I compress similar rows?
